FuncDef:
The bridge-domain profile command creates a BD profile and displays the BD profile view.
The undo bridge-domain profile command deletes a BD profile. The bridge-domain profile command creates a BD profile and displays the BD profile view. The undo bridge-domain profile command deletes a BD profile. By default, no BD profile is created. This command is supported only on the CE6863H, CE6863H-K, CE6860-SAN, CE6866K, CE6866, CE6860-HAM, CE6855-48XS8CQ, CE6885-SAN, CE8850-SAN, CE8855, CE8851-32CQ4BQ, CE8851K, CE8851-32CQ8DQ-P, CE8850-HAM, CE6881H, CE6881H-K, CE6885, CE6885-T, CE6885-LL (standard forwarding mode) and CE6863E-48S8CQ.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the ID of a BD profile.
The value is a string of 1 to 16 characters.

ExtraInfo: When a TRILL network is replaced with a VXLAN network, the VXLAN configuration workload is heavy. You need to bind VLANs and VNIs to BDs and configure EVPN-related commands in BDs. If there are a large number of BDs, the configuration workload is heavy. To solve this problem, the BD profile function is introduced. You can configure a BD to automatically bind VLANs and VNIs and automatically generate EVPN RD and RT commands in the BD profile. You only need to bind each BD to the profile to complete the preceding configurations.
